info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 01 at 7:58PM EDT until May 01 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR MERCER COUNTY... At 757 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenville, or 11 miles northeast of Hermitage, moving northeast at 30 mph. This storm was part of a line of severe storms stretching across most of Mercer County. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Mercer, Stoneboro, Sandy Lake, Clark, Fredonia, Jackson Center, New Lebanon, Sheakleyville, and Maurice K Goddard State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
